summary: Build an Android finance-tracking app for Guinea’s informal sector called “Gère Mon Argent” using FlutterFlow + Firebase, with a highly visual low-literacy UX, offline-first data entry with sync, sales/expense tracking, automatic calculations (available cash, daily profit, monthly progress), and monthly goals with performance visualization.
architectural_notes: Tech stack target: FlutterFlow app with Firebase backend (Firestore) and Android APK export.
Primary locale French; optional secondary local language; UX optimized for low-literacy with icon-first UI and large tap targets.

Backend data model: Users(id, prenom, type_activite, langue), Ventes(id, user_id, date, montant, produit), Depenses(id, user_id, date, montant, categorie), Objectifs(id, user_id, mois, objectif_mensuel).
Core formulas: available cash = Σ ventes − Σ depenses; daily profit = ventes_du_jour − depenses_du_jour; goal progress = (argent_cumule / objectif_mensuel) × 100.

existing_features.title: Create a mobile-first frontend with the 7 requested screens and navigation flow: Welcome (language selection + start), Profile Setup (first name + activity type via large icons), Dashboard (greeting + today available cash in GNF + two primary actions), Add Sale (amount + optional product), Add Expense (amount + category via large icons), Daily Summary (today’s sales list, expenses list, auto daily profit, motivational message), Monthly Goal (set goal, progress bar, remaining amount, link to view goals/history if implemented).

Implement offline-first data entry on the frontend: allow creating sales/expenses/goals while offline by queuing writes locally, and automatically sync queued actions to the backend when connectivity is restored, without data loss or duplicate entries.

Wire the frontend to the backend using the project’s standard actor/auth approach (Internet Identity), ensuring each user’s data is isolated and that profile creation is required before showing the main dashboard actions.

Implement the automatic calculations in the UI and/or backend (consistent and testable): available cash = sum(sales) − sum(expenses); daily profit = today sales − today expenses; monthly goal progress = (month net or month sales—use the definition shown in UI) / goal × 100, with safe handling when goal is 0 or missing.

Apply an accessible, low-literacy visual design system tailored to Guinea market traders: primary blue, success green, action orange; large buttons; large icons; simple typography; warm “modern African” feel; consistent spacing and contrast across all screens.

Add simple performance visualization elements for monthly progression and daily performance (e.g., progress bar for goal and a compact visual summary on dashboard/summary) while keeping the UI extremely simple.

Add generated static assets (illustrations + icons) to support a highly visual onboarding and category selection experience, and render them in the relevant screens from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images from the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Onboarding welcome screen with language selection (French + optional local language) and start flow
Profile creation: capture first name, activity type selection via icons, store user language
Dashboard: greet user, show today’s available cash (GNF), quick actions for adding sale/expense
Sales entry screen: amount (GNF) + optional product, save to backend
Expense entry screen: amount (GNF) + category via icons (Merchandise/Transport/Food/Other), save to backend
Daily summary screen: list today’s sales/expenses, auto-calc daily profit, show motivational message
Monthly goal feature: set goal per month, show progress bar and remaining amount, view goals
Offline mode with automatic synchronization when connectivity returns
Firebase backend schema: Users, Ventes, Depenses, Objectifs collections with specified fields
Automatic calculations: available cash = Σ sales − Σ expenses; daily profit; monthly progress percentage
Design system + accessibility: blue/green/orange palette, large buttons/icons, simple font, educational warm modern African style for low-literacy users
APK export and readiness for user testing/local deployment from FlutterFlow

Implement backend data model and APIs for a single-user-per-Principal cashbook: user profile, sales, expenses, and monthly goals, matching the provided collections/fields (Users: firstName, activityType, language; Sales: date, amount, product?; Expenses: date, amount, category; Goals: month, monthlyGoalAmount). Provide CRUD methods needed by the UI and computed-query methods needed for dashboard/summary/goal progress.
